task.title: Modifying the Theme
task.abstract: Staff users can store different page styles and branding configurations in the Themes tab. Themes control how various objects in the system appear to the user by allowing staff users to play with the Color Scheme, Logo, Custom CSS, Header, Footer, HTML Head, and Supernav. The Advanced Settings provide options for adding custom stylesheets so organizations can extend the look and feel of their existing website to the Community Portal.All URLs must originate from a secure site.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Themes tab in the Communities app and click New.

step.info: Optionally, enter a Description to differentiate between similar themes.

step.cmd: Configure the Color Scheme that is used throughout the Community Portal.
Populate the Logo Image and Favicon Image fields with the related image URL(s). All images must originate from a secured site.
step.info: Additionally, enter the website that users are directed to when clicking on the logo in the Community Portal. Users can populate the Logo Text field in order to include accompanying text if the logo is only an image.
Best practices recommend providing a Logo that is no larger than 20kb and has a resolution of 72dpi.

step.cmd: Staff users can Configure the Custom CSS, Header, Footer, HTML Head, and Supernav to overwrite the look and feel of standard pages, as well as adding additional resources and information.

choices.choice: Custom CSS- Customize the appearance of any page element. Cannot customize elements directly controlled by the Theme.
Header- Enter content for an additional page header; create drop down menus, buttons, etc. Optionally, hide the default header via Custom CSS.
Footer- Enter content for a footer.
HTML Head- Load custom style sheets, reference javascript library, add meta tags, or enter additional resources.
Supernav- Input additional text, buttons, drop down menus, and links within the Supernav.

step.info: Staff users have three Supernav HTML Positions.

choices.choice: Advanced Settings- Enter the Custom Stylesheet URL to extend the look and feel of an organization's existing website. By entering the Custom Stylesheet URL, staff users can override any of the Theme default configurations.

step.cmd: Once custom configurations are complete, click Save.

taskbody.result: A new Theme is created and is ready to customize invoices, forms, campaign pages, and pages in the Community Portal.
